titleStmt.title: The Christian testimony of some, called Quakers, at Reading, in Barkshire, to some fundamental truths of the Christian religion Giving an account, first, of twelve weighty queries, proposed to some preachers, and others of the people, called Quakers, at Reading, concerning some essential principles of the Christian faith. Secondly, our plain and positive answer to the said twelve queries, in twelve several positions, according to Scripture. Thirdly, a copy of a paper sent to them.
titleStmt.author: Sandilands, Robert.
Pain, William, fl. 1696.
Jaques, George.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by J. Bradford, in New-street, without Bishopsgate, near Hand-Ally,

notesStmt.note: By Robert Sandilands. Various parts supplied by Sandilands, George Jaques, and William Pain.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
